docs.snippet: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell’s compensation in 2012 made him among the best-paid executives in the country and perhaps the highest-paid leader of a nonprofit organization....
docs.lead_paragraph: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell’s compensation in 2012 made him among the best-paid executives in the country and perhaps the highest-paid leader of a nonprofit organization.
docs.abstract: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell was paid $44.2 million in 2012, making him among the best-paid executives in the country and perhaps the highest-paid leader of a nonprofit organization; amount, including deferred bonus and pension payment of $9.1 million, represents 50 percent increase from 2011.

headline.main: Goodell’s Pay of $44.2 Million in 2012 Puts Him in the Big Leagues
headline.print_headline: Goodell’s Pay in 2012 Puts Him in Big Leagues

docs.snippet: The way to help rid the league of its abusive locker room culture is for corporate sponsors to take a stand. It should be an easy call, but there’s big money at stake....
docs.lead_paragraph: The way to help rid the league of its abusive locker room culture is for corporate sponsors to take a stand. It should be an easy call, but there’s big money at stake.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column calls on NFL's corporate sponsors to take a stand against pervasively abusive locker room culture revealed by independent report; wonders if companies will have the courage to risk lucrative deals on matter of principle.

headline.main: Time for N.F.L. Sponsors to Demand Change

docs.snippet: An independent report into bullying accusations in Miami concluded that the taunting extended beyond the players Jonathan Martin and Richie Incognito....
docs.lead_paragraph: An independent report into bullying accusations in Miami concluded that the taunting extended beyond the players Jonathan Martin and Richie Incognito.
docs.abstract: Independent report commissioned by the NFL in wake of bullying accusations at the Miami Dolphins depicts deeply ingrained culture of verbal and physical abuse that extended far beyond players Jonathan Martin and Richie Incognito; recommends creation of new workplace conduct rules and guidelines that will help ensure that NFL players respect each other as professionals and people.

headline.main: ‘A Classic Case of Bullying’ on the Dolphins, Report Finds
headline.print_headline: ‘A Classic Case’ of Bullying Seen in an N.F.L. Team

docs.snippet: Focused on strength and bonding, it has a homoerotic component....
docs.lead_paragraph: Focused on strength and bonding, it has a homoerotic component.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Nicholas Dawidoff argues that professional football, based on strength, virility and manly bonding, has an unmistakable homoerotic component; holds fear of confronting this truth may motivate sport's notorious homophobia; holds sport could use a transformative moment in case of Michael Smith, who has come out as possibly NFL's first openly gay player.

docs.snippet: Darren Sharper, a six-time Pro Bowl safety, was charged in Los Angeles with drugging and raping two women in separate episodes in October and January....
docs.lead_paragraph: Darren Sharper, a six-time Pro Bowl safety, was charged in Los Angeles with drugging and raping two women in separate episodes in October and January.
docs.abstract: Darren Sharper, six-time Pro Bowl safety, is charged in Los Angeles with drugging and raping two women in separate episodes in October and January.

docs.snippet: The singing air traffic controller who coached the tiny Cape Verde Islands to unexpected lofty heights in African football was replaced by a geography professor on Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The singing air traffic controller who coached the tiny Cape Verde Islands to unexpected lofty heights in African football was replaced by a geography professor on Saturday.

headline.main: Cape Verde Replace Singing Coach With Geography Professor
headline.print_headline: Cape Verde Replace Singing Coach With Geography Professor

docs.snippet: Having escalated a war of words with his rivals, Jose Mourinho closed a week of petty sniping by admitting "football is at peace" after his Chelsea side were beaten by Manchester City in the FA Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: Having escalated a war of words with his rivals, Jose Mourinho closed a week of petty sniping by admitting "football is at peace" after his Chelsea side were beaten by Manchester City in the FA Cup.

headline.main: Peace Breaks Out After Mourinho's War of Words
headline.print_headline: Peace Breaks Out After Mourinho's War of Words

headline.main: Finney Was the Messi of His Time, Says Docherty
headline.print_headline: Finney Was the Messi of His Time, Says Docherty

docs.snippet: Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Nabil Bentaleb has agreed to play for Algeria at the World Cup in Brazil in June and is in the squad for next month's warm-up fixture against Slovenia....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Nabil Bentaleb has agreed to play for Algeria at the World Cup in Brazil in June and is in the squad for next month's warm-up fixture against Slovenia.

headline.main: Spurs Teenager Bentaleb to Represent Algeria at World Cup
headline.print_headline: Spurs Teenager Bentaleb to Represent Algeria at World Cup
